interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Spirited Away [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2017/05/30
Store: Daveigh Chase  (Actor),     Lauren Holly  (Actor),     Hayao Miyazaki  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
Product Description: ["From Hayao Miyazaki, one of the most celebrated filmmakers in the history of animated cinema, comes the Oscar(R)-winning triumph (2002, Best Animated Feature Film), filled with astonishing beauty and epic adventure, a dazzling masterpiece for the ages. SPIRITED AWAY is a wondrous fantasy about a young girl, Chihiro, trapped in a strange new world of spirits. When her parents undergo a mysterious transformation, she must call on the courage she never knew she had to free herself and return her family to the outside world. an unforgettable story, brimming with creativity, SPIRITED AWAY will take you on a journey beyond your imagination. It's a fantastic tale the whole family will want to experience over and over again on Disney Blu-ray!"]
Average Rating: 4.9
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'AC-3, DTS Surround Sound, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Michael Chiklis, Tara Strong, Susan Egan, Lauren Holly, Suzanne Pleshette, David Ogden Stiers, Hayao Miyazaki, John Ratzenberger, Original Story And Screenplay By Hayao Miyazaki, Daveigh Chase, Jason MardsenMichael Chiklis, Tara Strong, Susan Egan, Lauren Holly, Suzanne Pleshette, David Ogden Stiers, Hayao Miyazaki, John Ratzenberger, Original Story And Screenplay By Hayao Miyazaki, Daveigh Chase, Jason Mardsen  See more', 'Language': 'Japanese (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS-HD High Res Audio)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.63 Ounces', 'Item model number': '12670900', 'Director': 'Hayao Miyazaki', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, DTS Surround Sound, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 16, 2015', 'Actors': 'Daveigh Chase, Lauren Holly, Michael Chiklis, Suzanne Pleshette, Jason Mardsen', 'Dubbed': 'French, Japanese', 'Subtitles': 'French, English', 'Studio': 'Walt Disney Home Entertainment Presents A Studio Ghibli Film', 'Writers': 'Original Story And Screenplay By Hayao Miyazaki', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I had film on DVD but wanted to see if blue ray was sharper.  It does seem to be.  Such an imaginative film.  I think everyone should see it.

reference_summary:
Logan
Hugh Jackman  (Actor),     Patrick Stewart  (Actor),     James Mangold  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
["It's the year 2029, and much of the world's mutant population has succumbed to a genocidal, man-made virus. As a down-and-out Logan (Hugh Jackman, in his final appearance as the character) comes to terms with his failing healing factor, he and an ailing Charles Xavier (Patrick Stewart) must protect Laura (Dafne Keen)-a young genetically bred mutant with powers similar to Logan's-from the evil organization that created her. With Richard E. Grant, Boyd Holbrook, Stephen Merchant."]

profile:
**User Summary:**

This user maintains a robust preference for action and adventure films, particularly in the superhero genre, while expanding their interests to high-quality animated features. Their recent interaction reflects a strong affinity for visually stunning content, underscored by a commitment to Blu-ray formats that emphasize clarity and detail. The user continues to gravitate towards well-known actors and directors, reinforcing their appreciation for established talent and prominent cinematic teams, as demonstrated by their latest acquisition from a celebrated filmmaker.

While they are drawn to engaging narratives rich in emotional depth and character development, they exhibit an increasing interest in imaginative and fantastical storytelling. The focus on struggle and legacy remains evident, but their exploration of animated cinema shows a broader curiosity in diverse genres that still prioritize creative narratives.

The user highly values production quality and clarity in storytelling, as shown in their feedback on content. Their high ratings suggest satisfaction with their selections and a desire for films that not only entertain but also offer profound experiences. Overall, the user appreciates character-driven plots, clarity in storytelling, and lush visuals, marking them as an enthusiastic viewer invested in high-caliber cinematic adventures.
